node.title: Want to Avoid Omicron Two? We Have to Start Supporting Poorer Countries, Scientists Say
node.description: The recommendation comes after it was suggested that COVID variants could be more likely to arise in immunocompromised populations.

node.title: Germany Reports Over 925K in Country Currently Infected With COVID
node.description: "If all German adults were vaccinated, we wouldn't be in this difficult situation," Health Minister Jens Spahn told reporters in Berlin.

node.title: Man Caught Wearing Fake Arm While Getting COVID Vaccine: 'Ridiculous'
node.description: The man wore a silicone prosthetic to his vaccine appointment in Biella, a town near Turin in Italy.

node.title: Ukraine Says 'Worst' Scenario is Russia Invades Next Month, Kremlin Denies Plans to Attack
node.description: Ukraine's defense minister warned that a Russian "escalation" of tensions could happen by the end of January amid a buildup of troops at the border.

node.title: Internet Backs Man Who Says He Refused to Take Down Christmas Lights Despite HOA Complaint
node.description: "I'm so tired of unhappy people trying to ruin Christmas for others. Go Griswold my dude," one user commented on the post

node.title: Delta Still Dominant COVID Variant in U.S. Amid Omicron's Emergence, CDC Director Says
node.description: Omicron has now been detected in at least five states: California, Colorado, Hawaii, Minnesota and New York.

node.title: Man Charged in Half-Sister's Death After DNA Pulled From Conch Shell Used as Murder Weapon
node.description: David Reed was indicted last week in the 2001 death of Rose Marie Moniz after a Massachusetts cold case unit found a hair inside the shell.

node.title: Video of Dog 'Guarding Potato' Splits Opinion Online: 'Not Funny'
node.description: The video was meant to be a funny viral clip, but some were left disappointed by the joke.

node.title: Woman Gives Boyfriend Gift Engraved With Names of Girls He Cheated With in Viral Video
node.description: "She did the most funny [and] creative thing ever and respect to her for keeping her cool [until] giving him the present," wrote one commenter.

node.title: Oklahoma sues over National Guard vaccine requirement
node.description: The suit claims the "federal government is trying to disarm the state of Oklahoma from protecting itself."

node.title: Bride who uses wheelchair walks down aisle
node.description: Chelsie Hill said it was very difficult and she almost gave up, but her encouraging groom at the end of the aisle helped her get through it.

node.title: What to Cook This Weekend
node.description: We assembled an incredible list of holiday cookie recipes for you to start baking right now.

node.title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
node.description: Including bomb threats, bank robberies and more, the month’s action films pack a wallop.

node.title: Mary J. Blige’s Daily Affirmation, and 12 More New Songs
node.description: Hear tracks by Grimes, Hurray for the Riff Raff, Kim Petras and others.

node.title: In Africa, Dealing With Vaccine Challenges and the Omicron Variant
node.description: Vaccine shortages and skepticism, and rewarding countries for discovering variants. Also: Happiness and politics; unwanted children; beware of psychedelics.

node.title: Painter of Elijah Cummings Portrait Finds It’s a Career-Changer
node.description: The Baltimore artist Jerrell Gibbs was commissioned to paint Maryland’s late Representative. The official portrait will be installed at the U.S. Capitol.

node.title: Billions for Climate Protection Fuel New Debate: Who Deserves It Most
node.description: The $1 trillion infrastructure law funds programs that tend to favor wealthy, white communities — a test for Biden’s pledge to defend the most vulnerable against climate change.

node.title: Texas Woman Gives Birth in Parking Lot: 'No Pain, No Medicine, No Doctor'
node.description: Lubbock resident Jasmyne Hughes had been sent home from hospital that same day as medical staff thought the baby was not due.

node.title: Astronomers Find Scorching Hot Planet Where A Year Lasts 8 Hours
node.description: One of the lightest exoplanets ever discovered, GJ 367b has a surface temperature of over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, and orbits a red dwarf star.

node.title: South African Student Tested Positive for Omicron in Malaysia Before WHO Alerted to Variant
node.description: The Malaysian Health Minister said the student had already arrived in Malaysia and tested positive before South Africa alerted the WHO about their first case.

node.title: Parkland Student Arrested in School Shooting Threat, Mother Says It Was a Joke
node.description: "He's a normal kid from a normal family and a safe environment," his mother told local news station WSVN 7. "He doesn't realize the world is not so safe."

node.title: When Will Supreme Court's Abortion Rulings Come In? Why We Might Be Waiting a While
node.description: The Court generally issues all its opinions by the end of term, but that could be in June or even early July.

node.title: Trump Doubts Biden Will Seek Reelection in 2024: 'I Would Not Imagine He Would Be Running'
node.description: The former president said he gives his successor an "F minus" for the job he is doing leading the country.

node.title: COVID Hospitalizations Surge Across U.S., Even in Most Vaccinated States
node.description: President Joe Biden's winter plan does not include lockdowns, but it will involve an increased focus on booster shots and more frequent testing.

node.title: Military Families Can't Use Tap Water at Pearl Harbor Base After Fuel Leaks Into System
node.description: The Navy said that 680 Navy homes and 270 Army homes complained of a fuel odor or physical side effects after consuming water from its system.

node.title: Botswana’s leader says foreign diplomats who traveled from Europe were among the first known Omicron cases.
node.description: Botswana and South Africa were the first countries to identify cases involving the Omicron variant.

node.title: U.S. could be unable to pay its bills in weeks as debt limit approaches
node.description: The Bipartisan Policy Center updated its "X date" projections to fall between December 21 and January 28, 2022.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (December 5)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: ‘More Democratic, and Less Toxic’: Turning a Troubled Theater Around
node.description: René Pollesch is the fourth boss of the Volksbühne in four years. The Berlin theater is pinning hopes of a return to its former vibrancy on his collaborative approach.

node.title: In Cyprus, Pope’s Plea for Migrants Clashes With Island’s Tensions
node.description: As he celebrated Mass, Pope Francis urged Cypriots to welcome refugees and embrace their home’s history as a crossroads of cultures. But the government says it is overwhelmed.
